_header: Hail be ye hend that sitteth in this hall
_description: Greetings to audience by entertainer at beginning of ‘mirths’ — six cross-rhymed quatrains

OxfLinLat130.First Lines:
Hayl be ȝe hende þat syttyþ in þys hallegod for
                    hys godnes glady ȝou alonehys a fayr fayr feleschyp fayr hem
                    fallelord & lady & mayny schon…
OxfLinLat130.Last Lines:
…Whanne our merþe ys ymad of merþys & gameIhesu
                    þat in heuene y crouned ys kyngGraunt ous alle grace with outen any
                    fameIn blysse to hauen our dwellyng
